title: What is the meaning behind the song Love by BTS? - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe RM wrote this song because he was inspired by the similarities between the words “live” and “love”. In English, there’s only a one letter difference. In Korean, “people” is 시람 (salam) while “love” is 시랑 (sarang/salang). In the Love Yourself storyline, RM’s solo corresponds to LY: Her. The song is all about the development of love. There’s amazing meanings behind every lyric, but for the sake of keeping this short, I’ll focus on some of the very literal ones. I’m just a person, person, person You erode all my sharp edges You make me Into love, love, love Take a look at the Korean characters again. See how the characters are exactly the same except for the box in the bottom of the last character for “people” vs. the circle in the bottom of the last character for “love”? When RM says “you erode all my sharp edges”, he means that the box is turning into the circle, changing from just a person into love. You make I to an O I to an O I found out because of you Why “person” and “love” sound similar¹ You make live to a love Live to a love I found out because of you Why a person must love as they live This is a wordplay on the English words “live” and “love”, since to change “live” into “love”, you just have to change the “i” to an “o”. The distance between I and U is far but F*** JKLMNOPQRST This is really interesting to me because he illustrates the distance between himself and the person he’s talking to using the alphabet, which I thought was super cool. Hope this helps!
